patterns::​composite
interface
patterns::​ .​composite
patterns::​ .​composition_leaf
patterns::​ .​composition_node

Composite design-pattern.

composite provides an interface for a single composite in a composite, and may either be a leaf or an inner-node.

The composite pattern provides a means for composing objects into tree structures to represent part-whole hierarchies.

Composite lets clients treat individual objects and compositions of objects uniformly.

Composite Identifiers
uid
pure virtual function int uid()

Returns an instance id that is unique accross the instance's type, but that is not universally unique.

Such id can then be used to link between different types of nodes in a composite by giving them the same per-type id, yet diffrentiate between them by inspecting their universally unique id.

uuid
pure virtual function int uuid()

Get the composite's Universal-Unique-Identifier.

Composite Inquiries
depth
pure virtual function int depth()

Get the depth of the composite relative to the root.

index
pure virtual function int index()

Get the index of a composite as a child of its parent.

child_index
pure virtual function int child_index(
composite 
_child
)

Get the index of <_child> as a child of the composite in its queue of children().

Parameters
_child
composite

A child of the composite for which a corresponding index should be returned.

num_children
pure virtual function int num_children()

Get the number of children in the composite's list of children().

Composite Hierarchey

The below functions provide the interface to a composite's children hierarchy.

The composite interface design assumes user familiarity with the possible types of composite classes, and its implementation should follows the same assumptions.

The meaning of this assumption in regard to implementation is that a concrete implementation should only be provided in components of the composite type, and that a call to any of the below methods made on a leaf composite indicates a bug in the logic of the user, and therefore should produce a fatal error.

This is a design decision made in order to prefer transparency over type safety, and leave the control in the hands of the user of this API.

root
pure virtual function composite root()

Get the root of the composite hierarchy.

parent
pure virtual function composite parent()

Get the composite's parent.

set_parent
pure virtual function void set_parent(
composite 
_parent
)

Set <_parent> as the parent of this composite.

Parameters
_parent
composite

The parent to set.

child
pure virtual function composite child(
int 
_index
)

Get the composite's child at the specified <_index>.

Parameters
_index
int

The index of the child in the composite's list of children().

children
pure virtual function iterator children()

Get a builtin SystemVerilog queue containing the composite's children in the order they were set/added.

add_child
pure virtual function void add_child(
composite 
_child
)

Add <_child> to the composite's list of children().

Parameters
_child
composite

The child to be added to the composite's list of children().

add_children
pure virtual function void add_children(
iterable 
_children
)

Add <_children> to this composite's queue of children().

Parameters
_children
iterable

A queue of children to be added to the back of the composite's queue of children().

remove_child
pure virtual function void remove_child(
composite 
_child
)

Remove <_child> from this composite's children.

Parameters
_child
composite

The child to remove from the composite's queue of children().

remove_child_at
pure virtual function void remove_child_at(
int 
_index
)

Remove the child at the specified <_index> from this composite's children.

Paremeters
_index

The index of the child to be removed from the composite's queue of children().

remove_children
pure virtual function void remove_children()

Remove all of the composite's children(), making it a leaf node in the hierarchy until new children are added to it.

Composite Hierarchy - Iteration Interface
next_child
pure virtual function bit next_child(
ref 
composite 
_child
)

Iterate over composite's children, setting <_child> to the next child handle of this composite.

Returns

  • 1 upon success setting <_child> to the next child in the composite's children() queue.

  • 0 upon error, setting _child to null, or reporting a fatal if called on a leaf composite.

prev_child
pure virtual function bit prev_child(
ref 
composite 
_child
)

Iterate over composite's children, setting <_child> to the previous child handle of this composite.

Returns

  • 1 upon success setting <_child> to the previous child in the composite's children() queue.

  • 0 upon error, setting _child to null, or reporting a fatal if called on a leaf composite.

first_child
pure virtual function composite first_child()

Get the first child in the composite's queue of children().

Returns

  • A handle to the first child composite upon success.

  • A null handle if called on a composite composite which has no children().

  • reports a fatal error if called on a leaf composite (see Group documentation of the composite Hierarchy Interface).

last_child
pure virtual function composite last_child()

Get the last child in the composite's queue of children().

Returns

  • A handle to the last child composite upon success.

  • A null handle if called on a composite composite which has no children().

  • reports a fatal error if called on a leaf composite (see Group documentation of the composite Hierarchy Interface).

dft_child
pure virtual function composite dft_child()

Get the child of the composite, in Depth-First-Traversal order.

Returns

  • A handle to the Depth-First-Traversal ordered child composite upon success.

  • A null handle if called on a composite composite which has no children().

  • reports a fatal error if called on a leaf composite (see Group documentation of the composite Hierarchy Interface).

bft_child
pure virtual function composite bft_child()

Get the child of the composite, in Breadth-First-Traversal order.

Returns

  • A handle to the Breadth-First-Traversal ordered child composite upon success.

  • A null handle if called on a composite composite which has no children().

  • reports a fatal error if called on a leaf composite (see Group documentation of the composite Hierarchy Interface).

Ownership Interface
has_parent
pure virtual function bit has_parent()

Returns 1 if a parent composite is set for the composite, or 0 otherwise.

has_child
pure virtual function bit has_child(
composite 
_child
)

Returns 1 if <_child> is a direct child of the composite the method was called on, or 0 otherwise.

has_children
pure virtual function bit has_children()

Returns 1 if this composite has 1 or more children, or 0 otherwise.  Note that this does not check whether or not a composite can have children, but only if it has children.

has_next_child
pure virtual function bit has_next_child(
ref 
composite 
_child
)

Returns 1 if <_child> is not the last child of the composite this method was called on, or 0 otherwise.

has_prev_child
pure virtual function bit has_prev_child(
ref 
composite 
_child
)

Returns 1 if <_child> is not the first child of the composite this method was called on, or 0 otherwise.

Logical Interface
is
pure virtual function bit is(
composite 
_other
)

Performs an identity check, returning 1 if <_other> is a handle pointing to this composite, or 0 otherwise.

is_not
pure virtual function bit is_not(
composite 
_other
)

The negated form if the is() identity check method.

is_root
pure virtual function bit is_root()

Returns 1 if the composite is a root composite, or 0 otherwise.

is_leaf
pure virtual function bit is_leaf()

Checks if the composite is a composite type composite and returns the result.

Returns

  • 1 if the composite is a leaf composite, i.e. a composite which can not have children, and represents a leaf in the composite hierarchy graph.

  • 0 if the former condition does not hold.

is_node
pure virtual function bit is_node()

Checks if the composite is a composite type composite and returns the result.

Returns

  • 1 if the composite is an inner node in the composition graph.

  • 0 if the former condition does not hold.

is_index_valid
pure virtual function bit is_index_valid(
int 
_index
)

Checks if <_index> is a valid index to a child in the composite's queue of children().

Returns

  • 1 if <_index> is a valid child index to this composite's children() queue.

  • 0 if the former condition does not hold.

is_parent_of
pure virtual function bit is_parent_of(
composite 
_child
)

Checks if the composite is a parent of <_child> and returns the result.

Returns

  • 1 if the composite is a parent of <_child>.

  • 0 if the former condition does not hold.

See Also

is_child_of()

is_child_of
pure virtual function bit is_child_of(
composite 
_parent
)

Checks if the composite is a child of <_parent> and returns the result.

Returns

  • 1 if the composite is a child of <_parent>.

  • 0 if the former condition does not hold.

See Also

is_parent_of()
